snippet: The combined company is expected to become the world’s second-largest telecom equipment manufacturer behind Ericsson of Sweden.
abstract: Nokia announces it has agreed to all-stock acquisition deal with Alcatel-Lucent, which it values at around $16.6 billion; combined company will most likely become second-largest telecom equipment manufacturer in world.

byline.original: By MARK SCOTT and DAVID JOLLY
byline.contributor: Mark Scott reported from London, and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The combined company is expected to become the world’s second-largest telecom equipment manufacturer behind Ericsson of Sweden.

headline.main: Nokia Agrees to $16.6 Billion Takeover of Alcatel-Lucent
headline.print_headline: Rivals Join to Compete in Telecom Equipment
